data.title: Frequently Asked Questions
data.meta_description: What's Les Mills Plus? How can I use Les Mills Plus at home or on the go? Find all the answers to your questions here!
data.text:
LES MILLS+ is an online workout platform giving you the best, authentic Les Mills workouts anywhere, anytime on almost any device. Get the most out of your workout routines with access to over 800+ free at home workouts, full body workout plans and nutritional knowledge to improve your training.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

Yes, you can use LES MILLS+ when you travel. Thereâs a simple 3 step process to make sure you can access your favorite workouts, anywhere.

STEP ONE: Make sure youâre all signed up for LES MILLS+. You can registerhere.

STEP TWO: Download the LES MILLS+ app for your device before you leave home, thensign in.

STEP THREE: Connect to a good WiFi signal, choose your workout, and go for it!

Using an iOS device? With the LES MILLS+ iOS app, you can download workouts for up to 14 days and view them at your convenience.

If you want to use LM+ when traveling, please use one of our apps, as you will not be able to access the website from an unsupported country.

Yes. LES MILLS+ offers a free 14-day trial on Monthly, 3-Monthly Annual plans for new customers to try out our entire portfolio of workouts. If youâre not satisfied within the 14 days, you can cancel your account before your trial ends and you will not be charged.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

To cast a workout video to your TV using Chromecast you'll first need to select a workout video and press the play icon to start the video. Once the video is playing, press the Chromecast button on your screen before making it full screen, and select the device you would like to cast to. Once connected, your video will appear on your big screen and your device's screen will update to let you know you are casting.

If you're having trouble casting or cannot see the casting icon, please follow the steps below:

From your device, open the Google Home app (if you do not have this app, you will need to download ithere

Click on the Devices button showing on the top right corner of screen

Look for your Chromecast - if it's listed then it's on the same network as your device. If it's not, then it may be connected to another network. It will need to be connected to the same network as your device to pair correctly.

Once you've confirmed your Chromecast is on the same network, please open the LES MILLS+ app and try casting again!

To access LES MILLS+ from your ROKU device, you will first need to add the LES MILLS+ channel to your Roku - please ensure you have the latest version of the channel created in May 2018.

Downloaded channel

Click to open and sign in using your registered email address

You will be shown an activation code and an URL to visit watch.lesmillsondemand.com/activate) via your phone or computer

The page you land on will ask for your email address - please enter this in

Go to your emails on your mobile device or computer and click on the activation link

The page will refresh and ask you to enter this code which will link this device to your account

Once activated, the page will refresh and confirm successful log in. LES MILLS+ will refresh on your Roku device and sign you in so you can begin working out.

Watch tutorial video on how to sign in with Roku.

Need to log out of the LM+ Roku app?

To log out go to the menu bar on the right, click the 'settings' menu item and then once on the settings screen click 'log out' and then click 'yes' to confirm.

There are many ways to communicate on or about LES MILLS+ with other subscribers to share your journey, give feedback and find support! SQUAD in the navigation will link you through to our closed Facebook group. FORUMS is a user-generated area to find like-minded people and engage in challenges, feedback and goal setting. COMMENTS are also enabled on every video so you can let us know what tracks you love, which ones are tough and what you want more of!

Watch tutorial video on how to engage with LES MILLS+ online community.

LES MILLS+ workouts cater for all levels of fitness. Whether you are a beginner or train regularly our full suite of workouts and workout plans will help you smash your fitness goals. If strengthening and toning is what youâre after, BODYPUMP is the workout for you. If youâre keen to burn fat and send your cardio fitness through the roof, you canât go past BODYCOMBAT. Whatever the program, there will be options to start slowly and take low-impact options throughout the workout. Check out our SMARTSTART section for advice on how to get started.

If youâre already exercising regularly and have a good base level of fitness, you might be ready to introduce some HIIT into your schedule with the LES MILLS GRIT Series.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

Anyone, of any age or fitness level can work out with LES MILLS+ and see awesome fitness benefits. If you havenât worked out with us before, click on the workout you want to access and watch it first. We mean thatâ¦ kick back, relax and enjoy the music. Once youâve seen what youâre about to do, youâll feel more confident jumping in and giving it a go.

For your first workout, start with just 20 minutes of one workout and see how you go. If youâre tired, and feel like youâre short of breath then thatâs enough. Youâll be able to do more next time.

Many of the LES MILLS+ workouts donât require any equipment at all. All you need is space to move safely (we recommend at least 6sqm of clear space). All of our workouts also offer non-equipment alternatives.

BODYPUMP and LES MILLS GRIT Strength are weights-based workouts that use a barbell and/or weights plates, LES MILLS CORE requires a resistance band and weight plates and RPM requires a stationary cycle.

Itâs important that you hydrate before and after your workout. You donât need anything fancy, good old H2O will do the trick.

Our technique videos will help you master the moves for each program. We recommend you watch these before you start a workout for the first time. In addition, each workout contains technique guidance from our instructors - you must listen carefully and follow all guidance.

If at any time you feel you are exercising beyond your current fitness abilities, or you feel discomfort, pain, dizziness, or nausea, you should discontinue exercising immediately.

You are responsible for exercising within your limits and assume all risk of injury to your person or property.

If youâre looking for a full-body weights workout, that will get you lean, toned and fit â fast, try BODYPUMPâ¢.

You will need a barbell with weights and a bench, along with comfortable clothes and supportive shoes. Donât worry if youâre an absolute beginner; we start you off with light weights and teach you to get stronger. You can even start off doing half classes for the first week. Increase the weights and duration as your strength and fitness increase.

You may be sore the day after you do BODYPUMP for the first few weeks; embrace this feeling! BODYPUMP really challenges all of your major muscle groups. We recommend you do no more than two or three classes a week, with at least a day off.

As long as you have been cleared by your midwife or doctor, BODYPUMP is fine for you to do if you are pregnant. We recommend some modifications to the workout for pregnancy; you can find them here.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

Build your flexibility, strength and inner serenity with our two yoga-fusion mind body workouts.

BODYBALANCEâ¢ is ideal for anyone and everyone. You bend and stretch through a series of simple yoga moves and embrace elements of Tai Chi and Pilates which strengthen your body and lower your stress levels.

BODYBALANCE is a yoga-based class that will improve your mind, your body and your life. It strengthens your entire body and leaves you feeling calm and centered.

Comfortable clothes and something warm to wear during the final relaxation phase are all you need. You donât need shoes and yoga mats are optional. Itâs fine if youâve never done a yoga. Simply follow the instructors as they will show you all of the appropriate options.

Youâll feel real benefits from doing a class just once a week. Doing two or three classes a week will really help you improve.

BODYBALANCE can help maintain core control and muscle balance when you are pregnant; just check with your doctor or midwife before giving it a go. We recommend some modifications to the workout for pregnancy; you can find them here.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

LES MILLS GRITâ¢ Cardio is our 30-minute high intensity interval training workout that improves cardiovascular fitness, increases speed and maximizes calorie burn. Itâs designed to challenge your fitness, and there are options throughout the workout so you can modify the intensity.

LES MILLS GRIT Cardio is designed to complement your training schedule, so doing a workout twice a week is enough to give you awesome results. All you need is your usual workout clothes and a big attitude.

LES MILLS GRIT Cardio is designed with set exercises that have safety and science at their core. Theyâve all been tried and tested for safety and results. If you have any specific health concerns, check with your doctor first. High intensity interval training is not recommended if you are pregnant.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

LES MILLS COREâ¢ is a targeted core workout designed to improve core strength which will build a stronger, leaner body.

The moves in LES MILLS CORE are simple and you choose the intensity, so it suits any fitness level. For awesome results, we recommend you do it two or three times per week.

All youâll need is a single weight plate and a resistance tube (available at all leading sports stores). If you donât have a weight plate, you can use a dumbbell, kettlebell, weight bag, sandbag or medicine ball. Wear comfortable workout clothes and supportive shoes too.

LES MILLS CORE can be a great workout during the first and second trimester of pregnancy with some modifications. You can find out more here.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

BODYSTEPâ¢ is a full-body cardio workout designed to shape and tone your body using simple step movements on a height adjustable step.

You will need a step or low bench, along with comfortable clothes and supportive shoes.

New to BODYSTEP? Donât worry, there are options to suit everyone. If youâre using a height-adjustable step, start with a low step height. Focus on your feet before trying the arm movements and follow the options provided by the on-screen presenting team. It usually takes a few BODYSTEP workouts before you start to feel comfortable.

Safety is our number one priority, so we recommend talking with your doctor or midwife who will advise you appropriately as they have the best knowledge of your medical history.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

RPMâ¢ is a cycling workout that delivers maximum results with minimum impact on your joints. All you need is a stationary bike. Tune in to some great music and get your pedals spinning as your instructor takes you on a journey of hill climbs, sprints and flat riding. You control your own resistance levels and speed so you can build up your fitness level over time.

The key to RPM is having your bike set up correctly - be sure to do this before you start. Some of the tracks in RPM involve getting off the bike seat. If this doesnât work on your bike you can stay seated.

Most home bikes only require regular footwear, but if you have pedals designed for cycling shoes, youâll need those too. If youâre unsure, unscrew your pedals and take them into your local cycling store - they can help you out.

We recommend you do RPM two or three times a week to get great fitness results. RPM can be a great workout during pregnancy, you may have to reduce the intensity and avoid some of the climbs out of the saddle - remember to chat with your doctor or midwife first.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

BODYCOMBATâ¢ is a high-energy martial arts-inspired workout that lets you punch and kick your way to fitness and burn up calories, fast. Itâs perfect for releasing stress - youâll have a blast and feel like a champ.

All you need for a BODYCOMBAT workout is light, supportive shoes, and a whole lot of energy and enthusiasm. For awesome results, we recommend you do BODYCOMBAT two to three times per week.

You donât need any kind of martial arts experience. The instructors will demonstrate simpler and lower impact options for every move, so you can progress at your own pace and get an awesome workout at the same time.

We donât recommend BODYCOMBAT during pregnancy.

Want to give it a go?

START YOUR FREE TRIAL

BORN TO MOVEâ¢ kid workout classes combine fun and fitness. Featuring music and moves suitable for kids and teens these classes inspire movement, innate joy and focus on building self-esteem.

BORN TO MOVE caters for any child between the ages of 2-16 years. Each of the age-specific classes feature age-appropriate moves and music that have been tested with young people and are designed to help create positive physical habits.

Each class is carefully crafted to safely meet the unique developmental needs of that age group and draws on the latest developmental research. Of course, your child wonât notice â theyâll be too busy having fun.

START YOUR FREE TRIAL
